snippet: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel said his department would extend a pilot program giving victims of sexual assault legal representation and would consider allowing them more influence in sentencings.
abstract: Members of Congress cautiously applaud new Pentagon policies that are intended to improve the legal system for victims of sexual assault in the military, but changes do little to alter the way those crimes are adjudicated.
lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel said his department would extend a pilot program giving victims of sexual assault legal representation and would consider allowing them more influence in sentencings.

headline.main: Pentagon’s Sexual Assault Policies Greeted With Care
headline.print_headline: Pentagon’s Sexual Assault Policies Greeted With Care

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
